analyzed: zhing las thong gshol kri sha ka / kinytsa ka ni cung zad dang // pha rol byis pa'i khrag la'o //

original: pra tsa l'i ka mda' 'phen dang // rma bya gnod sbyin lag 'gro la //🔽pharka r'i ka tsa pe ta //
analyzed: pra tsa l'i ka mda' 'phen dang // rma bya gnod sbyin lag 'gro la // pharka r'i ka tsa pe ta //
translated: [It is used for] pracalāṭaka, for shooting arrows, and for peacock, yakṣa, and slow-moving.

original: pharka ri kam 'jam po la //
analyzed: pharka ri kam 'jam po la //
translated: [It is used for] parkarīka, and for the soft.

original: ba ge ru ka 'khyog po'i dbye //
analyzed: ba ge ru ka 'khyog po'i dbye //
translated: [It is used for] vageru, and for the division of crooked.

original: rlung med pa dang lcug ma la //
analyzed: rlung med pa dang lcug ma la //

original: ka pa rnga ka mig 'bras dag / brang po sa bon mdzod lte ba //
analyzed: ka pa rnga ka mig 'bras dag / brang po sa bon mdzod lte ba //

original: ba randa glang po yi //
analyzed: ba randa glang po yi //
translated: [It is used for] varāha, and for elephant.

original: tshor reg lang tsho'i tsher ma dang // de bzhin kun nas zlum po //
analyzed: tshor reg lang tsho'i tsher ma dang // de bzhin kun nas zlum po //

original: brta r'u ka chu klung dbye //
analyzed: brta r'u ka chu klung dbye //
translated: Vartula is a river.

original: @171a * // dza le ba da bya rog tshang //
analyzed: @171a * // dza le ba da bya rog tshang //

original: sgo nga'i gnas la yang 'dod do //
analyzed: sgo nga'i gnas la yang 'dod do //

original: barb'a r'i ka nag po che //
analyzed: barb'a r'i ka nag po che //
translated: Varavara is a great black one.

original: skra yi bkod pa yal ga la //
analyzed: skra yi bkod pa yal ga la //
translated: The arrangement of hair is a branch.🔽Valahaka is a water-carrier.

original: ba l'a h'a ka chu 'dren dang // klu dang lha min khyad par rig / b'a ni dza ga tshong pa'i rtags //🔽ri dags mtshan ma 'dod ldan ma //🔽doo rba ngang ni /
analyzed: ba l'a h'a ka chu 'dren dang // klu dang lha min khyad par rig / b'a ni dza ga tshong pa'i rtags // ri dags mtshan ma 'dod ldan ma // doo rba ngang ni /
translated: The sign of a deer is a lustful one.🔽Durbara is a path.

original: rjes chags tshig / brind'a ra ka lha dang gtso //
analyzed: rjes chags tshig / brind'a ra ka lha dang gtso //

original: yid du 'ong dang tshogs par dran //
analyzed: yid du 'ong dang tshogs par dran //
translated: Manohara is a gathering.🔽Brihahika is a tiger.

original: bri ha hi k'a stag ldan dang // gos kyi khyad par dag la'o //
analyzed: bri ha hi k'a stag ldan dang // gos kyi khyad par dag la'o //

original: bhatt'a ra ka lha dang ni //
analyzed: bhatt'a ra ka lha dang ni //
translated: Bhattaraka is a god.

original: sa skyong dka' thub nor can la //
analyzed: sa skyong dka' thub nor can la //
translated: It is also a king, an ascetic, and a wealthy one.

original: bha y'a na ka stag dang ni //
analyzed: bha y'a na ka stag dang ni //

original: seng ge dang ni 'jigs rung la //
analyzed: seng ge dang ni 'jigs rung la //
translated: It is also a lion and a fearful one.🔽Bhariyati is a wife.

original: bh'a r++y'a ti ka chung ma dang // nges rgyal 'phrog byed khyad par la //
analyzed: bh'a r++y'a ti ka chung ma dang // nges rgyal 'phrog byed khyad par la //

original: bhra ma ra ka sprin sbrang chang //
analyzed: bhra ma ra ka sprin sbrang chang //
translated: Bhramaraka is a cloud, a bee, and a drink.

original: aadzdz'a na dang phye ma dang // mdung 'dzin zhes pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: aadzdz'a na dang phye ma dang // mdung 'dzin zhes pa rnams la'o //

analyzed: mando da kam sems chags dang // kun tu byug pa dag la'o //

analyzed: mandal kam gzugs dang ni // mdze yi bye brag dregs pa la // bee de ha ka tshong pa dang // srad bu rje rigs bu la'o //
translated: [The word] maṇḍalaka is for 'form'.🔽[The word] kuṣṭha is for 'leprosy', and [the word] viśeṣa is for 'distinction'.

original: bee n'a shi ka skad cig pa //
analyzed: bee n'a shi ka skad cig pa //

original: gzhan dbang dang ni lte ba'i ba la //
analyzed: gzhan dbang dang ni lte ba'i ba la //

original: sha t'a ni ka thub pa'i dbye //
analyzed: sha t'a ni ka thub pa'i dbye //
translated: [The word] śatānīka is for 'sage', and [the word] sthavira is for 'elder'.

original: rgan po sdong po spyang ki khyi //
analyzed: rgan po sdong po spyang ki khyi //
translated: [The words] dāru, vṛka, and śvā are for 'tree', 'wolf', and 'dog'.

original: ce sbyangs dang ni sbre'u la //
analyzed: ce sbyangs dang ni sbre'u la //
translated: [The words] śarabha and śaśa are for 'leopard' and 'hare'.🔽[The words] śilātala, taila, and tīvra are for 'oil', 'strong', and 'peak'.

original: shi l'a ta ka snum dang drag / shringga ta sgo'i lcog dang // lam gyi bzhi mdo dag la'o //
analyzed: shi l'a ta ka snum dang drag / shringga ta sgo'i lcog dang // lam gyi bzhi mdo dag la'o //

original: sam gh'a ti k'a sna ma sbyar dang // sna dang chu snod kutta n'i //
analyzed: sam gh'a ti k'a sna ma sbyar dang // sna dang chu snod kutta n'i //

original: spre'u'i dra ba dag la'o //
analyzed: spre'u'i dra ba dag la'o //

analyzed: sam dam shi ka rkam pa dang // lcags kyi 'khrul 'khor rab dbye la //

analyzed: aa pra t'i ka dbang ldan dang // phyogs kyi glang po lha yi gzugs //

original: shri ga li ka ce spyang mo //
analyzed: shri ga li ka ce spyang mo //

original: skrag pa dang ni 'bros pa la //
analyzed: skrag pa dang ni 'bros pa la //

analyzed: shee ka ti kam ma yi snod //

original: bkra shis srad bu dag la ni //
analyzed: bkra shis srad bu dag la ni //

original: de bkod dang ni the tshom la'o //
analyzed: de bkod dang ni the tshom la'o //

analyzed: ma y'u ra ka spangs ma dang // aa p'a m'arga'i shing la'o //

analyzed: ma ru ba ka myos byed dang // me tog dbye ba dbu ba sngos //

analyzed: b'a na ba ka do shal dbye //

original: byis pa skyes ngan mkhas pa la //
analyzed: byis pa skyes ngan mkhas pa la //

original: mrishta'i ru ka smra byed ma //
analyzed: mrishta'i ru ka smra byed ma //

analyzed: ra ta rdhi kam bde ba'i 'khrus //

original: bkra shis brgyad pa dang nyin mo //
analyzed: bkra shis brgyad pa dang nyin mo //

analyzed: la t'a li ka aa mra'i lcug / rdo rje'i khu tshur la yang dran //

translated: It is also the conch. Ajisa is the equal.🔽It is also the battle. Urja is the one who delights, and the agent.

translated: Oujra, diligence and strength.🔽Kanya, hair and Brahma.🔽Kanya, ambrosia and lotus.🔽Kuji, hell.🔽Coal.🔽Kunja, a she-mule, a tree,🔽an elephant and a tooth.🔽Kunja, a hunchback, a particular tree.🔽Bhruttra, a tree,🔽itching and worms.🔽Ganya, a temple.🔽Gurjari.🔽A treasury.🔽Garja, copulation.🔽Garjaprashasta.🔽Kunja, a crow, a cicada, a pathaha and a part of sound.🔽Dvija, a Brahmin.🔽Born from an egg.🔽Dvija, a hermit.🔽Son, good dust.🔽Dvaja, a banner, a flag.🔽Sondhika, a lord.🔽

analyzed: 'og tu phyogs pa la //

analyzed: bhu dza dang ni bhu dza dag / dpung pa dang ni lag pa dang // ma dang pha dang gnyis ka la'o //

analyzed: ru tsa nad dang aungga la //

analyzed: lanydza / da ra dang mtha' ngos la //

analyzed: l'a dz'a 'dzin dang 'bras so ba //

analyzed: l'a dza gsher ba'i 'bras la'o //

original: l'a dzi / pu shel rtse la brjod //
analyzed: l'a dzi / pu shel rtse la brjod //

original: b'a dza phyogs la yang 'gyur te //
analyzed: b'a dza phyogs la yang 'gyur te //

original: sgra dang thub pa'i bye /
analyzed: sgra dang thub pa'i bye /
translated: The word sound is also used for the mute and the deaf.

original: (thags pa/) brag la'ang //
analyzed: (thags pa/) brag la'ang //
translated: The word cloth is used for a woven and a woven cloth.

original: b'm dzam mchod sbyin don dang la //🔽mar la'o b'i dzi rgyud dang ni //🔽nye bar len dang khu ba la //
analyzed: b'm dzam mchod sbyin don dang la // mar la'o b'i dzi rgyud dang ni // nye bar len dang khu ba la //
translated: The word to give is used for the purpose of worship and the purpose of sacrifice.🔽 The word to hold is used for the continuum and the semen.

original: by'a dza kun tu 'dzin don dang // de nyid g-yo dang mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: by'a dza kun tu 'dzin don dang // de nyid g-yo dang mi ston pa'o //
translated: The word to grasp is used for the grasping and the holding.

original: brdzu tshong pa dang ni klog / sadzdza go bgos kun tu 'byung //
analyzed: brdzu tshong pa dang ni klog / sadzdza go bgos kun tu 'byung //
translated: The word to deceive is used for the trader and the reader.🔽 The word to arise is used for the arisen and the trader.

original: sanydza bde 'byung tshong pa dang // sva dza rdul dang rang skyes dang // khrag dang de bzhin bu la'o //
analyzed: sanydza bde 'byung tshong pa dang // sva dza rdul dang rang skyes dang // khrag dang de bzhin bu la'o //
translated: The word to be born is used for the dust, the self-born, the blood, and the son.

original: aangga dzam ni sgra dang dga' //
analyzed: aangga dzam ni sgra dang dga' //
translated: The word limb is used for the sound and the joy.

original: bu dang bde bas dregs pa dang // yan lag 'dzin dang glang po che //
analyzed: bu dang bde bas dregs pa dang // yan lag 'dzin dang glang po che //
translated: The word limb is used for the son, the pride of happiness, the holding of limbs, and the elephant.

original: aangga dza ni khrag la'o //🔽aanda dza ni bya dang nya //
analyzed: aangga dza ni khrag la'o // aanda dza ni bya dang nya //
translated: The word limb is used for the blood.🔽 The word bird is used for the bird and the fish.

original: rtsangs pa sprul dang gla rtsi dang // sgong skyes rnams la'o //
analyzed: rtsangs pa sprul dang gla rtsi dang // sgong skyes rnams la'o //
translated: The word bird is used for the lizard, the snake, the musk, and the egg-born.

original: aambu dze // mtsho skyes dang ni ni tsu la //
analyzed: aambu dze // mtsho skyes dang ni ni tsu la //
translated: The word lotus is used for the born from a lake and the nicula.

original: chu'i lcang ma /
analyzed: chu'i lcang ma /
translated: The word lotus is used for the water cane.

original: kombi dza ni yul glang po //
analyzed: kombi dza ni yul glang po //
translated: The word kombi is used for the country and the elephant.🔽 The word kombi is used for the cow.

original: sham ga'i dbye ba rnams la bstan //
analyzed: sham ga'i dbye ba rnams la bstan //
translated: The various kinds of shami are taught.🔽Karajani is for hand-born,

original: ka ra dza ni lag skyes @176b dang // stag sen dang ni sen mo la'o //
analyzed: ka ra dza ni lag skyes @176b dang // stag sen dang ni sen mo la'o //
translated: tiger's claw, and nail.

original: k'am po dza ni /
analyzed: k'am po dza ni /
translated: Kamboja

original: zla ba'i shun /
analyzed: zla ba'i shun /
translated: is for lunar spot.

original: dung dang klu shing rta rnams la'o //
analyzed: dung dang klu shing rta rnams la'o //
translated: Shankha, nagakesara, and ratha are for conch, snake plant, and chariot.

original: kam bo dz'i ni sran ma'i 'dab //
analyzed: kam bo dz'i ni sran ma'i 'dab //
translated: Kamboja is also for lentil petal.

original: shing kun lo ma la yang 'dod //
analyzed: shing kun lo ma la yang 'dod //
translated: It is also asserted for the leaf of all trees.

original: k'a ru dza ni bzo bo dang // ri mo dang ni rang skyes snum //
analyzed: k'a ru dza ni bzo bo dang // ri mo dang ni rang skyes snum //
translated: Karujani is for artisan, painting, and naturally oily.

original: grog mkhar btsag dang dbu ba dang // glang phrug n'a ga ge sar la'o //
analyzed: grog mkhar btsag dang dbu ba dang // glang phrug n'a ga ge sar la'o //
translated: Varaha, chandana, and nagakesara are for boar, sandalwood, and nutmeg.🔽Kutaja is for a specific tree,

original: ku ta dza ni shing bye brag / bra bo che dang bum pa skyes //
analyzed: ku ta dza ni shing bye brag / bra bo che dang bum pa skyes //
translated: big millet, and pot-born.

original: gi ri dza ni ri yi bu //
analyzed: gi ri dza ni ri yi bu //
translated: Girja is for mountain-born.🔽Bhramara is for bee,

original: zhang po / kho ru d'a hri d'a //
analyzed: zhang po / kho ru d'a hri d'a //
translated: and krodha is for anger.🔽Girja is also for thorn-apple,

original: gi ri dzam ni lhang tsher dang // lcags dang brag zhun dri bzang la //
analyzed: gi ri dzam ni lhang tsher dang // lcags dang brag zhun dri bzang la //
translated: iron, bitumen, and fragrant🔽jala is for born in mud,

original: dza la dzam ni 'dam skyes dang // chu skyes padma ru rta dung //
analyzed: dza la dzam ni 'dam skyes dang // chu skyes padma ru rta dung //
translated: water-born lotus, and conch.

original: pa ranydza ni til 'khrul 'khor //
analyzed: pa ranydza ni til 'khrul 'khor //
translated: Parnaja is for sesame oil-mill.🔽Khadira is for sword,

original: ral gri dbu ba bor ba'i 'dab //
analyzed: ral gri dbu ba bor ba'i 'dab //
translated: and vartaka is for discarded petal.

original: p'a ni dzya ni tshong pa dang // 'tshe byed byed pa'i khyad par la //
analyzed: p'a ni dzya ni tshong pa dang // 'tshe byed byed pa'i khyad par la //
translated: Pāṇḍya is a merchant, and also a particular kind of robber.

original: ba la dz'a ni tshong tshong zong //
analyzed: ba la dz'a ni tshong tshong zong //
translated: Bāḍha is a merchant, a merchandise.

original: kha dog ldan pa'i bud med la //
analyzed: kha dog ldan pa'i bud med la //
translated: Bāḍha is a woman with a good complexion.

original: ba la dzam ni sa dang zhing //
analyzed: ba la dzam ni sa dang zhing //
translated: Bāḍha is land, a field,

original: lo tog yul dang ba lang lhas //🔽bh'u mi dz'a sprul la aa na k'i //
analyzed: lo tog yul dang ba lang lhas // bh'u mi dz'a sprul la aa na k'i //
translated: a crop, a country, a cow, a god.🔽Bhūmija is a snake, a nāga.

original: dmyal ba ngan skyes bh'u mi dza //
analyzed: dmyal ba ngan skyes bh'u mi dza //
translated: Bhūmija is a bad birth, a hell being.

original: murga'i lo ma ba na dz'a //
analyzed: murga'i lo ma ba na dz'a //
translated: Murjā is a peacock, a bird.

original: kha na dza ni glang po stag /'dam skyes nags byung ba na dzam //
analyzed: kha na dza ni glang po stag /'dam skyes nags byung ba na dzam //
translated: Kanajā is an elephant, a tiger, a lotus, a forest, a bird.

original: ba hu dza ni rgyal rigs bshad //🔽thig le khu ba spa yam dz'a //
analyzed: ba hu dza ni rgyal rigs bshad // thig le khu ba spa yam dz'a //
translated: Bahujana is said to be the kṣatriya caste.🔽The bindu is semen, and also a friend.

original: sa ha dza ni grogs med la //
analyzed: sa ha dza ni grogs med la //
translated: Sahāja is a solitary place,

original: gzhan gyi rtags can sa ha dz'a //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtags can sa ha dz'a //
translated: and also a place with the signs of others.

original: s'a ma dza na snyan tshig byung //
analyzed: s'a ma dza na snyan tshig byung //
translated: Sāmanja is a verse of praise.

original: brjod bya'i rtags can glang po la'o //
analyzed: brjod bya'i rtags can glang po la'o //
translated: Gaja is an elephant with the signs of what is to be expressed.

original: hi ma dz'a dang hi ma dza //
analyzed: hi ma dz'a dang hi ma dza //
translated: Himālaya and Himālaya

original: ri yi sras ma legs brjod ma //
analyzed: ri yi sras ma legs brjod ma //
translated: are the daughters of the mountain, well-spoken.

original: de bzhin mee n'a ka la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin mee n'a ka la'o //
translated: Likewise, Maināka.

original: aa hi bh'u dza rnam 'dul bu //
analyzed: aa hi bh'u dza rnam 'dul bu //
translated: Ahibhūta is a nāga.

original: 'brug sgra'i rjes su sgeg pa la'o //
analyzed: 'brug sgra'i rjes su sgeg pa la'o //
translated: After the word “thunder,” “beautiful.”

original: k'a smi ra da bong nga dkar //
analyzed: k'a smi ra da bong nga dkar //
translated: “Kāsmīra” is “white ass.”

original: ru rta gur kum padma la //🔽gra ha r'a dza zla nyi ma //
analyzed: ru rta gur kum padma la // gra ha r'a dza zla nyi ma //
translated: “Rūtaka” is “saffron,” and “padma” is “moon.”

original: dza gha n+ya dza zhes pa ni //🔽nu bo dang ni dmangs rigs la //
analyzed: dza gha n+ya dza zhes pa ni // nu bo dang ni dmangs rigs la //
translated: “Graharāja” is “sun,” and “jagannī” is “sister.”🔽“Jagati” is “younger brother,” and “dvija” is “śūdra.”

original: dvi dza ra dz'a ma chen mo'i mgon //🔽'dul byed bdag skyes khyad par la //
analyzed: dvi dza ra dz'a ma chen mo'i mgon // 'dul byed bdag skyes khyad par la //
translated: “Rājā” is “the lord of the great mother,” and “dāman” is “tamer.”

original: dharma r'a dza gshin rje dang // bde bar (khyung/) (rma bya/) gshegs dang g-yul ngor brtan //🔽bha ra dhva dza bla ma'i bu //
analyzed: dharma r'a dza gshin rje dang // bde bar (khyung/) (rma bya/) gshegs dang g-yul ngor brtan // bha ra dhva dza bla ma'i bu //
translated: “Dharmārāja” is “Yama,” and “kṣemaṅkara” is “Dṛḍha.”

original: stag gi tshogs dang thub pa la //
analyzed: stag gi tshogs dang thub pa la //
translated: “Bhāradvāja” is “the son of the guru,” and “vyāghra” is “the assembly of tigers.”

original: bh'a ra dv'a dza bre bo dang // shing bal gyi ni khyad par la'o //🔽bhri ga r'a dza sbrang rtsi'i btung //
analyzed: bh'a ra dv'a dza bre bo dang // shing bal gyi ni khyad par la'o // bhri ga r'a dza sbrang rtsi'i btung //
translated: “Bhāradvāja” is “the barber,” and “tūla” is “cotton.”🔽“Bhṛṅgarāja” is “honey,” and “śreṇi” is “the particular of a bird.”

original: sbre'u dang ni bya'i bye brag / yaksha r'a dza mig gsum grogs //
analyzed: sbre'u dang ni bya'i bye brag / yaksha r'a dza mig gsum grogs //
translated: “Yakṣarāja” is “the friend of the three-eyed one.”

original: r'a dza r'a dza nor sbyin dang // sa kun dbang dang ri dags mtshan //
analyzed: r'a dza r'a dza nor sbyin dang // sa kun dbang dang ri dags mtshan //
translated: “Rājā” is “Kubera,” and “sarvādhipati” is “the lord of the earth.”

original: kshi r'a bdhi dzam ri bong can //
analyzed: kshi r'a bdhi dzam ri bong can //
translated: “Kṣīradhī” is “the moon,” and “kṣīra” is “the rabbit.”

original: ksh'i r'a bdhi dz'a dpal mo la //
analyzed: ksh'i r'a bdhi dz'a dpal mo la //
translated: Kshārau badhijāḥ are the glorious ones.

original: ksh'a r'a bdhi dzam nya phyis dang // rgya mtsho'i lan tshva ras bal /
analyzed: ksh'a r'a bdhi dzam nya phyis dang // rgya mtsho'i lan tshva ras bal /
translated: Kshārāvadhijamnyaḥ are the salt of the ocean and cotton.

original: dag la'o // risha bha ra dh'a dzva'i sgra //
analyzed: dag la'o // risha bha ra dh'a dzva'i sgra //
translated: Rishbharadhvajaiḥ is the sound.

original: bde byed mchod pa'i khyad par (skye ga) @177a * //
analyzed: bde byed mchod pa'i khyad par (skye ga) @177a * //
translated: Śubhakṛtsnāḥ are the special offerings.

original: la // de nas mu ni bhee sha dzi //🔽drang srong ri byi /
analyzed: la // de nas mu ni bhee sha dzi // drang srong ri byi /
translated: Then munibheṣajāḥ are the sages.

original: aa ru ra //
analyzed: aa ru ra //
translated: Arūṇāḥ are the mountains.

original: 'gom pa la ste dza mtha'i sde'o /
analyzed: 'gom pa la ste dza mtha'i sde'o /
translated: Jamī is the step.

original: // / dzha ni spyod pa rlung dag la //
analyzed: // / dzha ni spyod pa rlung dag la //
translated: Jha is the conduct and the wind.

original: zhig pa la yang 'ga' zhig 'dod //🔽dzham dzha sgra yi bye brag la //
analyzed: zhig pa la yang 'ga' zhig 'dod // dzham dzha sgra yi bye brag la //
translated: Some say it is also the destruction.🔽Jham is the sound of the rain.

original: dzham ni chu 'khyags char pa la'o //
analyzed: dzham ni chu 'khyags char pa la'o //
translated: Jham is the sound of the rain.

original: dzha mtha'i sde'o /
analyzed: dzha mtha'i sde'o /
translated: Jha is the last syllable.

original: // nya ni dbye kha'i sgra dang ni //
analyzed: // nya ni dbye kha'i sgra dang ni //
translated: Nya is the sound of the dawn.

original: glu len pa la 'ga' yis bshad //
analyzed: glu len pa la 'ga' yis bshad //
translated: Some explain it as singing.

original: dzny'a ni mkhas dang blo la'o //
analyzed: dzny'a ni mkhas dang blo la'o //
translated: Jñāna is the wise and the mind.

original: bi dha'i sgra ni rmongs sems po //
analyzed: bi dha'i sgra ni rmongs sems po //
translated: The sound vidhi is the deluded mind.

original: pr'a dzny'a blo la pra dzany'a mkhas //
analyzed: pr'a dzny'a blo la pra dzany'a mkhas //
translated: Prājña is the mind. Prajña is the wise.

original: sam dzny'a ming dang glu len dang // sems pa drang srong bud med dang // long ba'i lag pa mgo dang ni //
analyzed: sam dzny'a ming dang glu len dang // sems pa drang srong bud med dang // long ba'i lag pa mgo dang ni //
translated: ṛṣi, woman, blind man, hand, head,

original: mig rnams kyi ni mtshon byed la'o //
analyzed: mig rnams kyi ni mtshon byed la'o //
translated: and eyes are the indicators.

original: kri ta dzny'a ni byas pa shes //
analyzed: kri ta dzny'a ni byas pa shes //
translated: Kṛtajñā is one who knows what is done.

original: snying po gzhal bya brjod bya ldan //
analyzed: snying po gzhal bya brjod bya ldan //

analyzed: kri s'i ta ni dga' ba dang // chu dang sgra tshogs 'byung gnas @178b dang // 'phrog byed rnams so tsakr'a ta //
translated: Kṛṣī is joy, water, sound, the source of the assembly, and the one who takes away. Cakrā is the one who turns.

original: dman dang khram pa du gsel ma //
analyzed: dman dang khram pa du gsel ma //
translated: Carvaṇā is the inferior, the deceitful, and the supplicant.

original: tsarba ta ni khyab pa dang // rgya che ba dang thal lcag dang // sarba ta la'o tsarba t'i //
analyzed: tsarba ta ni khyab pa dang // rgya che ba dang thal lcag dang // sarba ta la'o tsarba t'i //
translated: Carvata is the pervader, the extensive, the one who claps, and the one who is all-pervading.

original: phye ma'i bye brag la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phye ma'i bye brag la 'gyur ro //

original: ci bi ta ni sna leb dang // sna nyeg dang ni ri sri ta //
analyzed: ci bi ta ni sna leb dang // sna nyeg dang ni ri sri ta //

original: tsi rint'i legs gnas ma //
analyzed: tsi rint'i legs gnas ma //
translated: Cirintī is the one who dwells well.

original: lang tso gnyis pa'i bud med dang // spyod pa me tog ngan pa la'o //
analyzed: lang tso gnyis pa'i bud med dang // spyod pa me tog ngan pa la'o //
translated: Lañca is the woman of the second house, and the bad conduct of flowers.

original: dza ku t'i ni dza ku t'i //
analyzed: dza ku t'i ni dza ku t'i //

original: ri dang khyim la'o dza k'u tam //
analyzed: ri dang khyim la'o dza k'u tam //

original: rgya mtsho yi ni lan tsha la //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yi ni lan tsha la //

original: tri k'u ta ni dus bzangs la //
analyzed: tri k'u ta ni dus bzangs la //

original: tri pu ta ni zhen pa dang // sa t'i na ga la yang 'gyur //
analyzed: tri pu ta ni zhen pa dang // sa t'i na ga la yang 'gyur //

original: tri pu t'a ni me tog gi //
analyzed: tri pu t'a ni me tog gi //

original: dbye ba sug smel dur byid la //
analyzed: dbye ba sug smel dur byid la //

original: tram go ni dra ba'i dbye //
analyzed: tram go ni dra ba'i dbye //

original: bhoo t'anytsa l'i ma yang 'dod //
analyzed: bhoo t'anytsa l'i ma yang 'dod //

analyzed: tro h'a ta ni rngon pa dang // tshigs bcad rab dbye la 'dod do //

original: b'a ra ti /
analyzed: b'a ra ti /

original: rta / tsa ta ka //
analyzed: rta / tsa ta ka //

original: ro langs brtul zhugs can la'o //
analyzed: ro langs brtul zhugs can la'o //

original: nirta ta ni brtse med dang // gzhan snod khrag dang 'bras bu med //
analyzed: nirta ta ni brtse med dang // gzhan snod khrag dang 'bras bu med //

original: ni rkuta ni skyed tshal khyim //
analyzed: ni rkuta ni skyed tshal khyim //

original: nya pa dang ni sgo glegs la //
analyzed: nya pa dang ni sgo glegs la //

original: parba ta ni phye ma yi ;
analyzed: parba ta ni phye ma yi ;

analyzed: / rnam 'gyur dang ni sman bye brag / pa rishta ni bsten bkur dang // rab tu gsal dang 'tshol ba la //

analyzed: brka t'i ni sla ksha dang // s'a ka li yi shing dag la //

original: ras bal zhing las p'a tra ta //
analyzed: ras bal zhing las p'a tra ta //

original: pi tstsha ta /
analyzed: pi tstsha ta /

analyzed: mig / ki t'i rdul //

original: pi tstsha tam ni zha nye sogs //
analyzed: pi tstsha tam ni zha nye sogs //

analyzed: ba ra t'a ni dad pa gso // pa ra t'a ni gandho l'i //

original: parba ti ni rje rigs 'bru //
analyzed: parba ti ni rje rigs 'bru //
translated: Parvatī is a noble family grain.

original: b'arba ta ni chu srin la //
analyzed: b'arba ta ni chu srin la //
translated: Varbhata is a crocodile.

original: b'a runda ni byis pa la //
analyzed: b'a runda ni byis pa la //

original: bh'a k'u ta ni nya dang brag / bh'ar++y'a ta ni rngas 'tsho ba //
analyzed: bh'a k'u ta ni nya dang brag / bh'ar++y'a ta ni rngas 'tsho ba //

original: chags dang rang gi bud med phrad //
analyzed: chags dang rang gi bud med phrad //

original: bh'a b'a ta ni 'dod ldan dang // legs dang cha lugs lus dang gar //
analyzed: bh'a b'a ta ni 'dod ldan dang // legs dang cha lugs lus dang gar //

original: marka ta ni spre'u sdom //
analyzed: marka ta ni spre'u sdom //

original: bud med kyi ni byed pa la //
analyzed: bud med kyi ni byed pa la //

original: marka ti ni spre'u mo //
analyzed: marka ti ni spre'u mo //

original: sdom mo ne tso dra ba dang // lag pa lag skyes khyad par la //
analyzed: sdom mo ne tso dra ba dang // lag pa lag skyes khyad par la //

analyzed: m'arka ta ni sa bon dang // ka rka ta yi rgyal ba tsi na //

analyzed: skyu ru ra dang ba lang dang // dhu ka'i 'bras la'ang blta bar bya //

original: mo tsa ta ni tsan dan dang // nag pos 'tsho dang chu shing gi //
analyzed: mo tsa ta ni tsan dan dang // nag pos 'tsho dang chu shing gi //

original: rus dang nye bar byed pa la //
analyzed: rus dang nye bar byed pa la //
translated: In the action of a woman.

original: mo ra ti ni rtsa ba dang // aam ko ti ni me tog la //
analyzed: mo ra ti ni rtsa ba dang // aam ko ti ni me tog la //

analyzed: mo ra ta ni zhag bdun dang // 'o ma mchog dang m'urbi k'a //

original: ball'a ta ni glu mkhan dang // 'dod can ri mo tog tses 'tsho //
analyzed: ball'a ta ni glu mkhan dang // 'dod can ri mo tog tses 'tsho //

original: bi ka ta ni rnam gtsigs dang // yangs dang @179a * //
analyzed: bi ka ta ni rnam gtsigs dang // yangs dang @179a * //

analyzed: mdzes dang mchog la'o //

analyzed: be ka ta ni rnam mdzes dang // nya dang lang tshog sar pa la //

analyzed: be ra ta ni 'dres dang dman //

analyzed: rgya shug gi ni 'bras bu la //

analyzed: shee m'a ta ni lha yi gzhi // seng ge skra skar mon yul lo //

original: sam srishta ni b'anti sogs //
analyzed: sam srishta ni b'anti sogs //

original: legs par dag dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par dag dang 'grogs pa'o //

original: harma ta ni /
analyzed: harma ta ni /

original: s'o ma dang ; khang bzang /🔽bam gam / rus sbal la'o //
analyzed: s'o ma dang ; khang bzang / bam gam / rus sbal la'o //

analyzed: autstshingga nya'i dbye dang // skyes bu khro bar byed la'o //

analyzed: ga ra h'a ta chu skyes rtsa //

original: sha lya / dru dang me tog dbye //
analyzed: sha lya / dru dang me tog dbye //

original: k'a ma k'u ta tshogs can ma //
analyzed: k'a ma k'u ta tshogs can ma //

original: rnam par 'khyams dang tshogs can dga'//
analyzed: rnam par 'khyams dang tshogs can dga'//

analyzed: karppa pu na ngo tsha med //

original: smyo dang long bar byed pa la //
analyzed: smyo dang long bar byed pa la //

original: ka tam / na tam /
analyzed: ka tam / na tam /

analyzed: nya pa dang // gla sgang dang ni dmar po la'o //

analyzed: kunda k'i ta long ba dang // ngag dang mngon shes g-yo ba dang // dz'a ra dza yi bram ze ma //

analyzed: bu dang 'bangs mo 'dod can la //

analyzed: batka r'i ta spang leb dang // ral gri'i so dang brtul zhugs spyod //

analyzed: tsakra b'a ta /

analyzed: kra ya dang // chu zheng mtha' dang / gtsug phud shing //

analyzed: tsa tu: shashti grangs mang cha //

analyzed: hantri la'o // ba ra bushta gzhan 'dzin dang // gzhan gyis gsos dang tshong zong la //

analyzed: pra ti / krishtam gsang ba dang // zhing rmed las ni gnyis pa la'o // pra ti shishtam zhes pa ni //

analyzed: shi ba'i bishta ngan pa dang // pags pa ngan dang dbang phyug che //

analyzed: pr'anytsa lo ha rnams la'o //

original: shru ti ka ta /
analyzed: shru ti ka ta /

original: sems mang sprul //
analyzed: sems mang sprul //

original: sim ha tstsha ta zhes pa ni //
analyzed: sim ha tstsha ta zhes pa ni //

analyzed: klu shing dang ni ge sar la'o //

analyzed: da sha no tstshishta zhes pa /

analyzed: kha sbyor dang ni dbugs 'byin rten //

original: p'a t'a tsampa ta zhes pa //
analyzed: p'a t'a tsampa ta zhes pa //

analyzed: lcags dang 'khar ba rda zlum dang // 'thab dang rked pa rin chen zegs //

original: rlung dang / rnga chen /
analyzed: rlung dang / rnga chen /
translated: Wind, great drum,

original: rgya shug la'o //
analyzed: rgya shug la'o //
translated: jujube.

original: ta mtha'i sde'o /
analyzed: ta mtha'i sde'o /
translated: The last chapter.🔽Tha is the moon maṇḍala,

original: // / @179b tha ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang // stong pa bde byed mtho ba'i sgra //
analyzed: // / @179b tha ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang // stong pa bde byed mtho ba'i sgra //
translated: emptiness, bliss, high sound,

original: ka tha thub pa nges brjod dbye //
analyzed: ka tha thub pa nges brjod dbye //
translated: Ka tha is the sage, definitive speech,

original: lhag par de klog de rig lha //
analyzed: lhag par de klog de rig lha //
translated: the superior one, the knower of that.

original: kantha mgrin pa rtsib logs dang // zug rngu 'joms dang sgra dag la //
analyzed: kantha mgrin pa rtsib logs dang // zug rngu 'joms dang sgra dag la //
translated: Kantha is the throat, the side, and the destruction of pain and disease.

original: k'anth'a phyogs dang rab 'gyur gnas //
analyzed: k'anth'a phyogs dang rab 'gyur gnas //
translated: Kaṇṭha is the direction and the transformation of the place.

original: dus kyi 'jal byed mtshams dang ni //
analyzed: dus kyi 'jal byed mtshams dang ni //
translated: Kāla is the measure of time and the boundary.

original: thang shing la'o k'ashtham ni //
analyzed: thang shing la'o k'ashtham ni //
translated: Kāṣṭhā is the wood and the measure of time.

original: bud shing kuntha rmongs las med //
analyzed: bud shing kuntha rmongs las med //
translated: Kuṇṭha is the fuel and the delusion without fire.

original: kushtham nad dang nad mtshon byed //
analyzed: kushtham nad dang nad mtshon byed //
translated: Kuṣṭha is the disease and the weapon of disease.

original: goshtha nang dang lto ba khyim //
analyzed: goshtha nang dang lto ba khyim //
translated: Goṣṭha is the inside and the belly, the house.

original: k'u sh'ul dang rang gi ba'o //
analyzed: k'u sh'ul dang rang gi ba'o //
translated: Kuṣūla is one's own.

original: goshthi 'dun sa gtam gyi sa //
analyzed: goshthi 'dun sa gtam gyi sa //
translated: Goṣṭhī is the assembly and the talk of the assembly.

original: goshtham ba lang lha sa la 'dod //
analyzed: goshtham ba lang lha sa la 'dod //
translated: Goṣṭhamba is the cow, the god, and the city.

original: dzyashtha zla ba'i bye brag dang // gtso bo dang ni rgan pa la //
analyzed: dzyashtha zla ba'i bye brag dang // gtso bo dang ni rgan pa la //
translated: Jyeṣṭha is the distinction of the moon, the chief, and the elder.

original: dzyeshtha zhes pa skar ma dang // gtun shing sor mo'i khyad par la //
analyzed: dzyeshtha zhes pa skar ma dang // gtun shing sor mo'i khyad par la //
translated: Jyeṣṭha is the star, the pestle, and the distinction of the finger.

original: dushthu nyam chung tha ma la'o //
analyzed: dushthu nyam chung tha ma la'o //
translated: Duṣṭha is the weak and the last.

original: nishth'a nges thob rdzogs pa dang // nyams dang mtha' dang phul byung dang // slong ba dang ni nyon mongs la'o //
analyzed: nishth'a nges thob rdzogs pa dang // nyams dang mtha' dang phul byung dang // slong ba dang ni nyon mongs la'o //
translated: Niṣṭhā is the definite attainment, the completion, the decline, the end, the excellence, the begging, and the affliction.

original: y'a sh'a ma'i gnas /
analyzed: y'a sh'a ma'i gnas /
translated: Yāṣā is the place.

original: p'a tha klog / prishtham lus kyi rgyab phyi ma //
analyzed: p'a tha klog / prishtham lus kyi rgyab phyi ma //
translated: Priṣṭha is the back of the body.

original: phrashtha sngon 'gro gtso bo la //🔽pr'ashtha gtum mo dang ni sman //
analyzed: phrashtha sngon 'gro gtso bo la // pr'ashtha gtum mo dang ni sman //
translated: Praṣṭha is the head of the forepart.🔽Parṣṭha is the caṇḍāla and the physician.

original: banthams byas kun thob dang // gdung gi so dang mi'u thung //🔽sha tha ngan pa khram pa dang // bar du gnas pa dag la'o //
analyzed: banthams byas kun thob dang // gdung gi so dang mi'u thung // sha tha ngan pa khram pa dang // bar du gnas pa dag la'o //
translated: Vaṃśa is the teeth of the skeleton and the spine.🔽Śāṭha is the wicked and the deceitful.

original: sh'a tha le lo rmongs pa la //
analyzed: sh'a tha le lo rmongs pa la //
translated: Śāṭha is the middle and the abiding.

original: shreshtha mchog dang ku be ra //
analyzed: shreshtha mchog dang ku be ra //
translated: Śreṣṭha is the best and Kubera.

original: shashthi drug rnams rdzogs pa dang // 'phrog byed kyi ni btsun mo la //
analyzed: shashthi drug rnams rdzogs pa dang // 'phrog byed kyi ni btsun mo la //
translated: Ṣaṣṭha is the completion of the six and the queen of the thief.

original: ha tha stobs kyi byed pa dang // p'a ri pa li dag la'o //
analyzed: ha tha stobs kyi byed pa dang // p'a ri pa li dag la'o //
translated: Hāṭha is the function of strength and the pāripāṭha.

original: aa prashtha ni dus byis pa //
analyzed: aa prashtha ni dus byis pa //
translated: Aprattha is the time of the child.

original: aa bashtha ni rje rigs kyi //
analyzed: aa bashtha ni rje rigs kyi //
translated: Avaprattha is the son of the kṣatriya.

original: bu dang gnyis skyes yul phyogs la //🔽aa mbashth'a ni gam g'a skyes //
analyzed: bu dang gnyis skyes yul phyogs la // aa mbashth'a ni gam g'a skyes //

original: ma'i gnas dang ni tshogs la'o //
analyzed: ma'i gnas dang ni tshogs la'o //
translated: Mātṛkā is the abode of the mother and the assembly.

original: ka nishtha ni chung du dang // no go na chung nyam chung dang // mthe'u chung dang ni sor mo la'o //
analyzed: ka nishtha ni chung du dang // no go na chung nyam chung dang // mthe'u chung dang ni sor mo la'o //
translated: Kaṇṭha is the small, the short, the weak, the little finger, and the finger.

original: ka ma tha ni rus sbal la //
analyzed: ka ma tha ni rus sbal la //
translated: Kamatha means “tortoise.”

original: ka ma tham ni snod bye brang //

analyzed: katstshi s'a ka s'adzny'e la'o // shi khanda ni /

analyzed: sa randa ni sa ra ta //

analyzed: khram pa rgyan gyi khyad par la //

analyzed: aa po ganda byis pa can //

analyzed: lus ma tshad dang shin tu 'jigs //

analyzed: tsakra p'a da ri'i dbye ba // tsakra p'a d'am zlum po'o // dza ga randa chu sgyur ba ;

analyzed: / chu rdul dang ni sprul dag la //

analyzed: m'a dhi 'dab sogs bcom pa dang // nor dang / zhan dang gsal ba la // m'u dha le lo //

analyzed: rmongs pa la //

analyzed: r'a dha tshangs pa bzang dang mdzes //

analyzed: aa b'u dha ni /

analyzed: phung po sbo ma //

analyzed: smad dang sbed //

analyzed: durbba rnna ni bye ma can //

original: gzung dang mdog ngan la yang brjod //
analyzed: gzung dang mdog ngan la yang brjod //
translated: [The word] durvaṇa [also means] a place to be seized and an ugly color.

original: doorb'a nam ni mrishti'i 'dab //
analyzed: doorb'a nam ni mrishti'i 'dab //
translated: [The word] dūrvaṇa [means] the leaf of the plant Cissampelos pareira.

original: d'urb'a'i khu ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: d'urb'a'i khu ba la yang ngo //
translated: [The word] dūrvaṇa [also means] the juice of the plant Cissampelos pareira.

original: dru gha na ni thob dang // pa ra /
analyzed: dru gha na ni thob dang // pa ra /
translated: [The word] druhaṇa [means] obtaining and a thorn.

original: s'u dha 'tshe ba la //🔽dra bi nam ni pha rol gnon //
analyzed: s'u dha 'tshe ba la // dra bi nam ni pha rol gnon //
translated: [The word] saudha [means] a house and harm.🔽[The word] dāvana [means] a place to be seized and a place to be conquered.

original: gser dang 'byor pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gser dang 'byor pa la yang ngo //
translated: [The word] dāvana [also means] gold and wealth.

original: dha ra nam ni 'dzin pa dang // nga rgyal dbye ba dag la'o //
analyzed: dha ra nam ni 'dzin pa dang // nga rgyal dbye ba dag la'o //
translated: [The word] dhāraṇa [means] holding and the division of pride.

original: dha ra n'i ni sa la'o //
analyzed: dha ra n'i ni sa la'o //
translated: [The word] dhāraṇī [means] the earth.

original: dha ru ni ni chu dang ni //
analyzed: dha ru ni ni chu dang ni //
translated: [The word] dhāruni [means] water and

original: mtho ris dang ni mchog la gnas //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni mchog la gnas //
translated: heaven and a place of supreme abode.

original: dharm'a na ni sprul bye brag / rkang 'thung khyad par dag la yang //
analyzed: dharm'a na ni sprul bye brag / rkang 'thung khyad par dag la yang //
translated: And also the special trees.

original: dharsha n'i ni rigs tshogs ma //
analyzed: dharsha n'i ni rigs tshogs ma //
translated: Darsana is the collection of lineages.

original: dharsha nam ni mdzod dang dga //
analyzed: dharsha nam ni mdzod dang dga //
translated: Darsanam is the treasury and the virtuous.

original: dh'a ra n'i ni sangs rgyas gsung //
analyzed: dh'a ra n'i ni sangs rgyas gsung //
translated: Dharana is the speech of the Buddha.
